direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are part of the iterator interface and handle the state of the iterator, with 'next' advancing the iterator and 'hasNext' checking if there are more elements.
Both methods manipulate the internal state of the iterator, with 'next' advancing the iterator and 'reset' reinitializing it to the start.
Both methods depend on the internal state of the iterator and interact with the underlying collection, with 'next' retrieving elements and 'remove' modifying the collection.
Both methods access the underlying collection, with 'next' iterating over elements and 'size' retrieving the collection's size.
The 'next' method depends on the iterator created by the 'iterator' method, which is essential for its operation.
